nodes.text: Mike Mayhew is an American comic-book artist who work for Star Wars comics both for Dark Horse Comics and Marvel Comics.

Besides Star Wars, Mayhew has worked on Harris Publications' Vampirella, and on several Marvel and DC Comics titles, including Avengers and Justice League. His studio is located in Glendale, California.
Mike Mayhew illustrated The Star Wars, Dark Horse's comics adaptation of George Lucas's 1974 rough draft for Star Wars. He considers this draft an Apocalypse Now version of the Star Wars saga.

Mayhew has also penciled the fifteenth and twentieth issues of Marvel Comics' 2015 Star Wars series, as well as the one-shot Star Wars: The Last Jedi – The Storms of Crait 1. He has drawn the cover for the hardcover editions of the prequel trilogy's comic adaptations, the second issue of the The Force Awakens miniseries, and Star Wars issues 33–37 and Annual 2.

Mayhew has provided a variant cover for Star Wars 1, which is based on Rob Liefeld's cover for The New Mutants #98, as well as for the first and third issues of Star Wars: Lando. Moreover, he has drawn the Yesteryear Comics variant to the first issue of Marvel's miniseries Star Wars: Shattered Empire, and the Wizard/ComicConBox variant to the first issue of the Vader Down crossover event.
